channel.title: Compiling Trouble :(
channel.description:
Hello. When I try to compile it says that "You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 or 6.0 updates. Go to Mod Taharok's tutorial on Moparscape tutorial section for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK update. Press any key to continue...."
I have JDK 1.06 update 10. Why isn't this working? Help would be greatly appreciated link links to tutorials or instructions of your own. Thanks and hopefully this will work as I have tried everything. :(

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

Okay, thanks for your help. I’m going to restart at the moment, and hopefully it will work :P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2008, 04:14:29 pm[/size][hr]Alas! It works! Thanks so much I really appreciate it.

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

Okay well I have update 10, so I fixed 07 to 10, and I tried to run it again, and I get another message that says “Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with Xlint-:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue…”
Wtf is this now? Wow this is frustrating, lol Sorry for all of this, hopefully I can figure it out…with your help maybe

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(

item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

It should work, since it fits your JDK’s needs. It’s also a complete batch code.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

Yea I’m new to this so basically I should delete everything in the compiler file and just add that?
-Edit-
okay I deleted everything and just put that code and now it says it cannot find the path specified. hmmm? sorry for all this work, didnt mean to cause it, just kinda confusing :\

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

@echo off title *Title* "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

This is the code you’re looking for. The @echo off + pause’s job is to start and end the code. The title is the title of your client and the batch code is signifying the type of java you have to make the compiler work basically.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

mmk, so just add it? and yea i tried deleting everything and it didnt work out too well ;p ill try just adding it and see what happens. ill edit this once i get my result.
-edit-
nope i just added it to the bottom and i get the same message… why won it work

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

No, you still need the @echo off, title, the code, and pause to make the compiler actually work.

item.title: Compiling Trouble :(
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:4, topic:239689”][quote author=Dvs Chick link=topic=315981.msg2509869#msg2509869 date=1225228176]
How can I set up the proper path? Please explain as I am new to this if you couldn’t tell

Also, I have the right requirements for JDK correct?
[/quote]Set the path to c:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_10 in the batch file. I’m not giving out more information because I don’t want to spoonfeed, sorry.[/quote]

The batch file for the compiler or in environment Variables or what? I wouldn’t call it spoonfeeding if you’re helping somebody because I read every tut…but yea help is appreciated but I guess people don’t want to…all I need is what batch file to add that to :\

Read full topic
